problem: Find the integer $n,$ $-90 < n < 90,$ such that $\tan n^\circ = \tan 252^\circ.$
gptanswer:
Since the tangent function has period $180^\circ,$ we can subtract $180^\circ$ from $252^\circ$ repeatedly until we get an angle between $-90^\circ$ and $90^\circ.$

\begin{align*}
\tan 252^\circ &= \tan (252^\circ - 2 \cdot 180^\circ) \\
&= \tan (-108^\circ) \\
&= \tan (-108^\circ + 2 \cdot 180^\circ) \\
&= \tan 72^\circ \\
&= \tan (72^\circ - 1 \cdot 180^\circ) \\
&= \tan (-108^\circ) \\
&= \boxed{\tan (-18^\circ)}.
\end{align*}
